sentences: Peter Ecklund (September 27, 1945 â€“ April 8, 2020) was an American jazz cornetist.
In 1967, Ecklund received a degree from Yale University.
He went on tour with singer Paula Lockheart and started a jazz band, in addition to working with many pop and rock bands in the 1970s and 1980s.
He became a substitute for the Nighthawks Orchestra led by Vince Giordano and a member of the Orphan Newboys led by Marty Grosz.
Ecklund died April 8, 2020 from Parkinson's disease.
